articles.name: Everything You Need to Know about BETA
articles.body: u003Cpu003EDataValidation has just released the new Email Assurance app in beta! If you're one of our beta testers, this article is for you. Here's everything you need to get started in the new app:u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003ELink an ESP accountu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEmail Assurance allows you to link a MailChimp or Constant Contact account right off the bat! Do this when signing up, or add it later. You can add multiple accounts, and even upload .csv files if you'd like.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003ELinked and Unlinked Listsu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce you've linked all of your ESP accounts (and uploaded all of your .csv files) you can view all lists in the Linked Lists and Unlinked Lists tabs. Linked Lists include all email lists from any linked MailChimp or Constant Contact account.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EUnlinked Lists include any lists from a previously linked ESP account, and all .csv files you have manually uploaded. (ie. If you unlink an ESP account, you can still find your lists in this section)u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EReport Cardsu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEach list is given an Overall List Grade. This percentage is an average for a particular list.u0026nbsp;The front of each card will also tell you:u003C/pu003Eu003Culu003Eu003Cliu003EDate the list was imported to Email Assuranceu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003ENumber of subscribers in the listu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EESP Accountu0026nbsp;u003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EESP Account loginu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EWhether a list has been purchaseu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EHow many days remaining in your 30-day free trialu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EWhether a list is Assured/Not Assuredu003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cpu003EBy flipping a card over you can view the list's Report Card. A list's Report Card will tell you:u003C/pu003Eu003Culu003Eu003Cliu003EThe percentage of emails that have each Email Assurance gradeu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EA description of each Email Assurance Gradeu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EDate of the list's latest validationu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003ENumber of subscribers when the list was linkedu003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EProgress Reportsu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn a list's Report Card, you can click on Progress Report to see the list's progress over time. The Progress Report also tells you the Overall List Grade, number of subscribers in the list, date the list was imported to Email Assurance, and details on the linked ESP account.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

583419u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EBy clicking on the first data point you can see what your list looked like at the time of import. The Progress Report also shows the percentage of emails that have each Email Assurance grade. Easily compare Weekly Checks and Daily Checks.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EEmail Assurance runs once daily to check for newly added data and re-analyzes existing data weekly. It's free to monitor your lists for as long as you like.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EPurchase Email Assurance or Email Assurance to sync results back to your ESP account and get an address-by-address analysis for your lists.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003ESync back to an ESPu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIf you have a linked MailChimp or Constant Contact account, you can purchase Email Assurance or Email Assurance and have your results automatically synced back to your ESP account. If you have the Email Assurance subscription, your lists will be analyzed and synced back to your account daily.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EMailChimp users, u003C<a href=
u003Ecreate segmentsu003C/spanu003Eu003C/au003E and deploy only to your Safe to Send subscribers.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EConstant Contact users, u003C<a href=

u003Ecreate tagsu003C/spanu003Eu003C/au003E and deploy only to your Safe to Send contacts.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce you've purchased, you'll also have the option of downloading an address-by-address analysis in addition to your ESP sync. If you uploaded a .csv file, you will be able to download the address-by-address analysisu0026nbsp;as well.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EAddress-by-Address Analysisu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EThisu0026nbsp;is a downloadable .csv file that contains an address-by-address analysis for each email within a list. This analysis containsu0026nbsp;deliverability data that makes up the Email Assurance grade given to a particular address.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EThis downloadable report has Email Assurance Grades, Historical Engagement (Clicks, Opens), Historical Bounces, Historical Complaints, Historical Opt-Outs, History of Deceased, and History of Spam Traps.u003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003ELook here for more information on the u003C<a href=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EAdd to Cart or Downloadu003C/strongu003Eu003C/fontu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn the list view of the Email Assurance app, you have the ability to add multiple lists to a cart and download multiple items at a time.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EDashboardu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EYour Dashboard is where you can view the overall status and progress of all of the lists in your DataValidation account. Whether you have 1 linked account or 3, the Dashboard will show you Status Over Time, Assurance Coverage, New Emails Added, and Emails Unsubscribed for the current aggregate of all lists in the system.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EAggregate Score of All Listsu003C/strongu003E: This score can be found in the top left corner of your DataValidation Dashboard. The score takes into account every Overall List Grade.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EStatus Over Timeu003C/strongu003E: This percentage represents the changes (trending up or down) to the aggregate score of all lists.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EAssurance Coverageu003C/strongu003E: This is a percentage of all lists covered by the Email Assurance subscription. The only lists within your account that are available for the subscription are those that have been linked by MailChimp or Constant Contact.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003ENew Emails Addedu003C/strongu003E: This number is the total number of emails added to your lists at this particular moment. This includes manual uploads, new signups to your list oru0026nbsp;new addressesu0026nbsp;that have been recently pulled in by Email Assurance from your ESP account.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmails Unsubscribedu003C/strongu003E: This represents the total number of emails unsubscribed across lists. This takes into account the number of emails unsubscribed by DataValidation (due to an F grade) and the number of emails you have manually unsubscribed or that have unsubscribed themselves from your mailings.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003ELinked Accounts, Profile Settings, and Billingu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn the u003Cstrongu003ELinked Accountsu003C/strongu003E tab you can view every ESP account you have linked to DataValidation. Here, you can unlink an account and refresh accounts. If you unlink an account, Email Assurance WILL NOT be able to run.u0026nbsp;Refreshing an account pulls in any new/existing data from your ESP account (this can only be done once a day).u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn the u003Cstrongu003EProfile Settingsu003C/strongu003E tab you can verify and change your primary mailing address, update personal information and change your password.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn the u003Cstrongu003EBilling Informationu003C/strongu003E tab you canu0026nbsp;save a credit card for purchases, change billing information and view any purchases you have made. You can even view your receipt for every purchase you have made!u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003ENotifications u0026amp; Cartu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EWhenever you sync an ESP account, or upload a new list, you'll get notifications letting you know that your list has been analyzed.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EYou can now add lists to your cart and continue viewing reports within your Dashboard, Linked Lists, and Unlinked Lists. By clicking on the Cart notifications you can see what your total for the day is, as well as what an Email Assurance subscription would look like for the lists you are purchasing.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmail Assurance Productsu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmail Assurance Freeu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EWhen you link an account or upload a list, you automatically have Email Assurance Free. Monitor your lists to see their progress on a daily basis, for free. What you get with Email Assurance Free:u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Culu003Eu003Cliu003EAll lists get analyzedu0026nbsp;u003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EView a daily Report Card of listsu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EView a lists Progress Report over timeu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EView the Aggregate Score of All Email Listsu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EMonitor multiple ESP accounts or multiple uploaded listsu003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmail Assurance Paidu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EWhen you purchase validation on a list, from a linked account or a manual upload, you have Email Assurance Paid. You can continue to monitor your purchased lists, as well as those that are not purchased. Purchase a one-time validation andu0026nbsp;sync results back to your MailChimp or Constant Contact account and download an address-by-address analysis. Here's what you get with Email Assurance Paid:u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Culu003Eu003Cliu003EAll Email Assurance grades synced back to a linked ESPu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EAll F results are unsubscribed from the ESPu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EDownload an address-by-address analysis with detailed deliverability codesu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EReceive a 30-day free trial of Email Assurance [with a linked list]u003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmail Assuranceu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEmail Assurance is the full package! With this subscription, you can monitor all of your lists and have them remediated within your ESP account automatically. Here's what you get with the Email Assurance subscription:u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Culu003Eu003Cliu003EAll grades are synced to your ESP dailyu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EF results are unsubscribed (optionally)u003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EReceive a daily Report Cardu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003ENew emails added are analyzed and synced dailyu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003ENew address-by-address analysisu0026nbsp;with detailed deliverability codes dailyu003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EEmail Assurance 30-Day Free Trailu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EWhen you purchase Email Assurance Paid [the one-time validation for a list], you receive an Email Assurance 30-day free trial! This means that you get one month free of monitoring + remediation. With the 30 day free trial, you get all the benefits of having the Email Assurance subscription.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu0026nbsp;u003C/pu003E

articles.name: How do I update contact data before sending a campaign?
articles.body: u003Cpu003EIf you have a Constant Contact account that is linked to DataValidation, you have the option of having Email Assurance. Email Assurance is the ultimate list maintenance subscription, allowing you to monitor and remediate any Contacts automatically.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EWith Constant Contact, any additional data or information for Contacts (besides name, address, ect) must be stored a custom field. The only way to deploy campaigns to groups of Contacts, based on this custom data, is to create Tags.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEmail Assurance runs once every day, pulling in any new Contact data you have manually added to your lists,u0026nbsp;and has been added due signup forms. Existing data within your account is also re-ran on a weekly basis. u003Cstrongu003EWhat this means is that if you've created Tags for 'Safe to Send', 'Accepts All', and 'Indeterminate' Contacts, you'll need to make sure these are refreshed each time you deploy a campaign!u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003C<a href=

u003EHow do I create custom Tags in Constant Contact?u003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EHow to update Tags before sending a campaign:u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003ETo update Tags before sending, you'll follow almost the same procedure as creatingthem. First, you'll need to do an 'Advanced Search' for 'Safe to Send' Contacts only. These are the only contacts we recommend sending mail to.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003E'Safe to Send' Contacts are all those with A+ and A grades. Remember tou0026nbsp;search all Contacts (and not just those within a specific list). Also, all Email Assurance Grades are listed in the format: u003Cstrongu003E+dv_grade_A+u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce you hit 'Search' you'll be taken back to the main Contacts screen. Here, click the the top left check-box to select all Contacts listed as having Email Assurance Grades of A+ and A. Click on the 'Manage Tags' button that appears when you select all, and ensure that 'Safe to Send' has a check mark by it!u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003EThis is very important!u003C/strongu003E Doing this assures that the 'Safe to Send' Tag has been added to all new and updated contacts with A+ and A grades. Keep in mind, the status of an email can change on a daily basis. It is not unlikely that a Contactu0026nbsp;with a grade of D (Indeterminate) can become an A or A+.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EThis is what makes Email Assurance so awesome!u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu0026nbsp;u003C/pu003E

articles.name: How do I send to my 'Safe to Send' contacts only?
articles.body: u003Cpu003EOnce your Constant Contact account has been linked and your lists have completed the First Validation, your purchased lists will begin to sync back to your Constant Contact account.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003ECheck the Status of a List:u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EAccess the Contacts tab on the top right of your dashboard, and then click on the Activity tab. Here is where you can see recent imports, exports, and other transactions (such as those from DataValidation). When a list is synced back to your account, it will be listed as Activity Type: Import from external application.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003Eu003Cstrongu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003Cbr /u003Eu003Cbr /u003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce your list has been synced back, youu0026rsquo;ll need to create Tags for Contacts. These Tags will be used to manage the contacts within your Email Lists. You must create Tags for all u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo;, u0026lsquo;Accepts Allu0026rsquo;, and u0026lsquo;Indeterminateu0026rsquo; Contacts. Those given a grade of F can still be found by clicking View All Contacts, but will no longer be listed in the original Email List.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EDataValidation applies Email Assurance Grades (A+, A, B, F) to your Contacts by using Custom Fields. By default, DataValidation populates Custom Field 1 for grades (unless this field has already been used for additional information on your Contacts - In this case, access settings to determine which Custom Field was available).u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003ECreate a Tag: u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003ETo add Tags to a group of people (rather than individual contacts) you must be create them by searching all Contacts, filtering, and applying the Tag to your filtered results. Make sure you are under the Contacts tab on the left hand side of your Constant Contact dashboard and access the Advanced section on Search Contacts.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003EThe following tags will need to be created:u003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003ESafe to Send: A+ and A gradesu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EAccepts All: B gradesu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIndeterminate: D gradesu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EAdvanced Searches will use the format custom_field_1 1 [is] +dv_grade_A+. To create a u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; group, Advance Search your Contacts for all A+ and A results, and add the u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; Tag to all Contacts who meet this criteria.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce your search is complete, click the top left box to select all Contacts that meet the criteria and access the Manage Tags tab. Apply the Tag to this group of people. Your u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; group is now set up and ready to receive mail.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EYouu0026rsquo;ll need to do the exact same thing to create u0026lsquo;Accepts Allu0026rsquo; and u0026lsquo;Indeterminateu0026rsquo; Tags, and apply them to all Contacts that meet the criteria.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003ESend to the u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; Contacts Only:u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003ETo send to the u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; Contacts only, youu0026rsquo;ll need to narrow down lists when deploying a campaign. Under the Email tab on the top left of your dashboard, youu0026rsquo;ll be to create a new campaign, or access one already created. Once youu0026rsquo;re ready to send, select one (or multiple) lists to deploy your campaign to.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003E*This is very important: You must select all Email Lists you wish to send to u003Cemu003Ebeforeu003C/emu003E narrowing them down. If not, your tag will only apply to the lists selected before the Tag was applied. u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EAfter your Email list(s) have been selected, apply the Tag u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; to your list. Your campaign will be deployed to only the u0026lsquo;Safe to Sendu0026rsquo; Contacts within your list.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cstrongu003Eu003Cstrongu003Eu003Cimg src=

articles.name: What happens to Contacts with F grades?
articles.body: u003Cpu003EContacts given a grade of F are determined to be undeliverable (and unsafe to send to). If a Contact is given an F grade, the Contact will be unsubscribed from any lists it currently exists on within your Constant Contact account.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EThe contact will be unsubscribed, but will not be totally removed. You can still locate contacts with F grades under the 'View All Contacts' tab or by searching for the email address.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIf you access the individual Contact, you'll see that it has been unsubscribed from anyu0026nbsp;previous lists.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003E

articles.name: Why was my list flagged for review by DataValidation?
articles.body: u003EIf you linked an account or uploaded a list and got a message saying,

this means that your list has been flagged by our automated abuse detection program. This software scans our database to detect lists that areu0026nbsp;u003Cemu003Epotentiallyu003C/emu003Eu0026nbsp;harmful and pause their validation process until the list can be reviewed.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EWe do this to protect our system against a DHA, or Directory Harvest Attack, and keep the data of all customers safe. If a list has many addresses that are similar (ie. role addresses) such as sales@apple.com or support@apple.com, then it will be flagged for review.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003EIf you've noticed that your list has been flagged, you will ned to contact our support team atu0026nbsp;u003Ca style=

u003Esupport@datavalidation.comu003C/spanu003Eu003C/au003Eu0026nbsp;with this issue. Your email list will be forwarded to an engineer for further review and we'll contact you with the updated status of your list!u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

articles.name: Why is my MailChimp account not updating?
articles.body: u003E1. Make sure you have purchased your list from DataValidationu003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EAfter having a list analyzed you'll be able to purchase Email Assurance or Email Validation. Email Assurance is an ongoing subscription offered to customers with linked MailChimp accounts.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003E2. Make sure you have Uploaded Results to MailChimpu003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EOnce your list has processed, the Purchase Email validation button will change to a button that says
. From here you'll be able to
if you have a linked MailChimp account. You must push Upload Results for your MailChimp account to be updated.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

u003E3. Make sure you do NOT have more than 30 merge fields set in MailChimp.u003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EMailChimp's merge fields are where all subscriber information is stored, such as email address, phone number, ect. When uploading your information back to MailChimp, we attempt to create custom merge fields for the information found in your Email Assurance Report. MailChimp limits you to 30 merge fields, so you'll want to make sure that you have room for DataValidation's information.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEdit your merge fields by accessing your list in your MailChimp Dashboard. Under the the
tab, click on List Fields and *|MERGE|* tags. Make sure you have less than 30 fields so that DataValidation can properly upload your information.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=
u003E4. Make sure none of your merge fields are set to

u003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIf any of your merge fields are set to be required, your MailChimp upload may not load correctly. If a field is set to be required, it means that every subscriber entering information must include this data - even DataValidation.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=
u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003E**If your list still is not uploading, please contact a Customer Support Advocate at support@datavalidation.com.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003E

articles.name: What does the Progress Report tell me?
articles.body: u003Eu003Cstrongu003EProgress Reportsu003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EFor each list in your Email Assurance account you will have a Report Card and a Progress Report.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EIn a list's Report Card, you can click on Progress Report to see the list's progress overtime. The Progress Report also tells you the Overall List Grade, number of subscribers in the list, date the list was imported to Email Assurance, and details on the linked ESP account.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003Eu003Cimg src=

583419u003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EBy clicking on the first data point you can see what your list looked like at the time of import. You're able to also see in the Progress Report the percentage of emails that have each Email Assurance grade. Easily compare Weekly Checks and Daily Checks.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EEmail Assurance runs once a day, checking for any newly added data on a daily basis, and re-analyzing any existing data on a weekly basis. It's free to monitor your lists for as long as you like.u003C/pu003Eu003Cpu003EPurchase Email Assurance or Email Assurance to sync results back to your ESP account and get an address-by-address analysis for your lists.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003E

articles.name: How can I fix a suspended ESP account?
articles.body: u003EIf your account with an email service provideru0026nbsp;has been suspended, then may have received warnings andu0026nbsp;and know that you can no longer send email. When your account is suspended, your ESPu0026nbsp;is attempting to protect their own sender reputation by blocking you.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EThere are several reasons why your ESPu0026nbsp;may have suspended your account:   u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cul style=

u003Eu003Cliu003ETerms of Use Were Violatedu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EHigh Abuse Complaintsu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EHigh Bounce Ratesu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EHigh Unsubscribe Ratesu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EDirect Complaintsu003C/liu003Eu003Cliu003EEmail lists fall out of complianceu003C/liu003Eu003C/ulu003Eu003Cp style=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EHere's how you can fix your your suspended account:u0026nbsp;u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EWhen you're been suspended from sending, your ESPu0026nbsp;willu0026nbsp;let you know that you're unable to send mail. If you're a MailChimp or Constant Contact user, you can simply u003C<a href=

u003Elink an account u003C/au003Eto DataValidation andu0026nbsp;receive a Free Email Assurance Report for every email list. Monitor your lists for free, have list(s) cleaned up, and sync straight back to MailChimp or Constant Contact.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EIf you use another ESP, you can export problematic lists and upload to DataValidation! Receive a Free Email Assurance Report for every list uploaded, and monitor them for free. When you're ready to clean them up, you can have a list validated and download a Safe to Send list.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003EGet a Free Email Assurance Report!u003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

articles.name: What happens if I purchase a list, then unlink my account?
articles.body: u003EWhen you link a MailChimp account to DataValidation we create a connection with this account so that your email list data can be validated.u0026nbsp;u003Cstrongu003EDO NOT unlink your MailChimp account if you have connected it and purchased Email Validation for individual lists or Email Assurance for your entire account.u0026nbsp;u003C/strongu003EIf you unlink your account we will lose connection with MailChimp.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EIf you purchased Email Validation for a list in your linked MailChimp account and have then unlinked this account we will lose connection. You will then need to download the Yes Only or Yes + Maybe list and upload this .csv file to your MailChimp account in place of the old list. You can then re-link the account if you plan to validate this list again in the future or to validate other lists within your MailChimp account.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EIf you purchased Email Assurance for your linked MailChimp account and have then unlinked this account we will lose connection. With Email Assurance, every list in your linked account is covered. Therefore, if you unlink this account every list will be disconnected from DataValidation. You will then need to re-link your MailChimp account through the DataValidation dashboard, have your lists re-validated, and contact Support at: support@datavalidation.com.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

articles.name: DataValidation FAQ
articles.body: u003Eu003Cstrongu003EFAQsu0026nbsp;on DataValidation Pricing, Email Validation, Email Assurance, and the Always Free Email Assurance Report.u0026nbsp;u003C/strongu003Eu003C/spanu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EDo I have to sign up with a credit card?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003ENo, you do not need to use a credit card when signing up for DataValidation. Signup, load a list or link your MailChimp account, and receive an Always Free Email Assurance Report -u0026nbsp;u003Cspan class=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EDo I need to pay before validating my data?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003ENo, you do not need to pay before having an email list validated. Upload a list or link an ESP, have your list validated, and view your Always Free Email Assurance Reportu0026nbsp;u003Cspan class=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EHow do I know how much my list will cost?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003EEmail lists are priced on a per email basis. You can easily calculate the cost of your list using our pricing page before you purchase.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EIs there a minimum price I have to spend?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003ENo, there is no minimum price you must spend (or number of emails you must have) to validate with DataValidation. Although, some credit card companies do require a minimum of $0.50 to purchase.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EAre there requirements my list must have?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EThere are no requirements on the size of your list. Upload a list of any size, from anywhere, at anytime! We do require that uploaded files be in a .csv or .xls file, and that all emails be in the first column with no additional data in this column.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EHow long does it take to validate my email list?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003EThe time it takes to validate your list is based on the number of emails you have in this list. Generally, it takes only a couple of hours to validate!u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EHow do I use your service?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EBy creating an account, you can simply upload a list to be validated or link your MailChimp account and have your list(s) imported. After validation, view your Always Free Email Assurance Report to make an informed purchase decision. Youu0026rsquo;ll have the option of purchasing Email Validation for your email list or Email Assurance for a linked account.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EHow is my Email Assurance Report u0026ldquo;always freeu0026rdquo;?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003EWith DataValidation, you can upload a list at any time and get an Always Free Email Assurance Report. This report is always available for your viewing -u0026nbsp;u003Cspan class=

u003Eno purchase necessaryu003C/spanu003E! Upload as many lists as you need to check the deliverability status by using your Always Free Email Assurance Report. It's always free to know.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EWhat kind of information does the Email Assurance Report tell me?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EYour Always Free Email Assurance Report tells you if emails on your list are deliverable or undeliverable by providing you with Email Assurance Grades for the emails on your list. Purchase your list to get an Address-by-Address Analysis containing Deliverability Codes for each email. Codes are provided for historical bounces, historical complaints, historical opt-outs, spam traps, deceased individuals, historical opens and click data.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EDo you offer a subscription service?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EYes! By linking youru0026nbsp;MailChimp account, have all of the lists in this account validated and they'll be eligible for the Email Assurance subscription. This subscription monitors every list in your linked account to ensure compliance and deliverability. More on Email Assuranceu0026nbsp;u003C<a href=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EWhat is the difference in one-time Email Validation and the Email Assurance subscription?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EBy uploading an email list or linking an account, you can have any list cleaned as a one-time service. If youu0026rsquo;ve linked an account, you can also have a list cleaned one time, but you also have the option of signing up for the ongoing, monitoring subscription. With this subscription, all lists are validated and are updated daily.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=
u003Eu003Cstrongu003EWhy should I validate with DataValidation?u003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

u003EWith our self-service platform, you can easily upload lists of any size and link an ESP account with ease. The validation process is fast, comprehensive, and provides you with an Always Free Email Assurance Report to help you make an informed purchase decision. Automatically update your cleaned list with our monitoring subscription for ongoing list maintenance! u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp dir=

articles.name: Top MailChimp articles for DataValidation customers
articles.body: u003EFirst thingu0026rsquo;s first. As a MailChimp user and DataValidation customer we want you to be as educated as possible when it comes to the deliverability of your email lists. Glance at these best practices and compliance tips to get familiar with MailChimpu0026rsquo;s standards before getting started.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EStart out by making sure your list is okay to use in MailChimp. You can view some common scenarios of list building to double check if your list is okay. The rule of thumb is to make sure youu0026nbsp;u003Cspan class=
u003Ealwaysu003C/spanu003Eu0026nbsp;have permission to email the subscribers on your list. Use a double opt-in to ensure your subscribers want to receive your mail!u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003EIs my list okay to use in MailChimp?u003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EIf you want to be proactive, or you think you may risk getting flagged or suspended by MailChimp, youu0026rsquo;ll want to have your list cleaned of undeliverable emails. MailChimp doesnu0026rsquo;t do this for you, but luckily weu0026rsquo;ve got you covered. We partner with MailChimp and hope to provide you with the most information possible about this process.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003EWhy canu0026rsquo;t I use MailChimp to clean my list?u003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EOnce youu0026rsquo;ve had a list cleaned, we will update your MailChimp account and append all delivery data, including Email Assurance Grades and Deliverability Codes, to your lists. Weu0026rsquo;ll identify which emails are 'Safe to Send', 'Accepts-All', and 'Indeterminate'.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EWe recommend segmenting and deploying to the 'Safe to Send' emails only (with grades of A+ and A)u0026nbsp;to get the most out of your list. By having a list cleaned with DataValidation, youu0026rsquo;reu0026nbsp;sending to emails that have been verified as deliverable and do not have a history of bouncing, complaining, or being a spam-trap.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003EHow can I save and use segments in my list?u003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EOvertime your email list(s) have the potential of going stale. People change emails or start using new ones, pass away, and leave inboxes unattended to. The permission you asked for previously from all of your subscribers (through opt-in or double opt-in) goes stale, and this usually happens in only 3-6 months, causingu0026nbsp;your list to be stale. This can happen even after having a list cleaned multiple times. This is why we offer theu0026nbsp;u003Cstrongu003EEmail Assuranceu003C/strongu003Eu0026nbsp;subscription specifically for MailChimp customers!u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=
u003EWhen email addresses go staleu003C/au003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

u003EKeep your MailChimp list(s) clean with ongoing list maintenance! With the Email Assurance subscription, we'll monitor your lists on an ongoing basis and update them regularly so that you're always Safe to Send!u003C/pu003Eu003Cp style=

articles.name: I got blocked from my ESP, what should I do?
articles.body: u003EWe're sorry to hear you've beenu0026nbsp;blocked from your email service provider! Having your account suspended is never pleasant, but don't worry, we can help you fix this problem!u0026nbsp;Getting your email list validated will get you back to sending email and is the 1st step in getting back in compliance with industry best practicesu0026nbsp;and with your ESP's standards.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003EWant to keep a good IP Reputation?u003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003EDataValidation offers two products - one to help you start sending email again and another to maintain your email list, keeping you in good standing with your ESP.u0026nbsp;u003C<a href=

u003EEmail Validationu003C/au003Eu0026nbsp;is our one-time cleaning service, letting you link an account or upload a list and have it validated. This will clean your list an get you back compliance so that you continue sending email.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EBest practices states that you should have a list cleanedu0026nbsp;u003Cemu003Eat leastu003C/emu003Eu0026nbsp;once every 3 months. If you want to uphold your deliverability and keep a good reputation, focusing on list maintenance is your best bet.u0026nbsp;u003Cemu003EIt is possible to have a list cleaned andu0026nbsp;u003Cemu003Eto get blocked again from your ESPu0026nbsp;u003C/emu003Ewithin just a few months.u0026nbsp;u003C/emu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003ETo avoid being blocked from sending mail we've designed a service specifically for MailChimp customers!u0026nbsp;u003C<a href=

u003EEmail Assuranceu003C/au003Eu0026nbsp;is an ongoing list maintenance subscription, helping you to stay in compliance, uphold your reputation, and keep bad data off your lists for good.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003EHow do I get started with ongoing list maintenance?u0026nbsp;u003C/spanu003Eu003C/strongu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003ETo get you back in compliance with your ESP, weu0026rsquo;ll have you link your MailChimp account so that we can access each list. Your lists will be ran for deliverability issues concerning each individual email. When weu0026rsquo;re finished with your list(s), youu0026rsquo;ll receive an email letting you know it has been analyzed. From here, you can access a report for each list containing insight into why your emails are deliverable or undeliverable.u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EAfter viewing your reports, you'll have the option of purchasing Email Validation or Email Assurance. To ensure that your lists within your MailChimp account are protected,u0026nbsp;u003Cspan class=

u003Eu003Cemu003ERight now, only customers who have a MailChimp account can link an account to DataValidation and be eligible for Email Assurance. Want to request that we add your ESP? Email support@datavalidation.comu0026nbsp;u003C/emu003Eu003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

articles.name: Why was my list flagged for review?
articles.body: u003EIf you linked a MailChimp account or uploaded a list and got a message saying,

this means that your list has been flagged by our automated abuse detection program. This software scans our database to detect lists that areu0026nbsp;u003Cemu003Epotentiallyu003C/emu003E harmful and pause their validation process until the list can be reviewed.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

u003EWe do this to protect our system against a DHA, or Directory Harvest Attack, and keep the data of all customers safe. If a list has many addresses that are similar (ie. role addresses) such as sales@apple.com or support@apple.com, then it will be flagged for review.u0026nbsp;u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=
u003EIf you've noticed that your list has been flagged, you will ned to contact our support team atu0026nbsp;u003C<a href=

u003Esupport@datavalidation.comu003C/spanu003Eu003C/au003E with this issue. Your email list will be forwarded to an engineer for further review and we'll contact you with the updated status of your list!u003C/pu003Eu003Cp class=

articles.body: After results are updated inyour MailChimp account and creating segments for 'Safe to Send', 'Indeterminate', and 'Accepts All' categories, you can send campaigns to your subscribers based on these categories.

>How do I create segments in MailChimp?

**We do not recommendsending to the 'Accepts-All' segment. We recommend thatyou attempt a re-engagement campaign to emails with an Email Assurance Grade of B, and if any addresses in your 'Accepts-All' category are determined to be valid, you can then trickle them back into your 'Safe to Send' list very slowly!

**We do not recommendsending to the 'Indeterminate' segmentever. You should create a segment for all emails with an Email Assurance Grade of D - but youshould not deploy to them. The reasoning is, we do not want to unsubscribe these from your list so that Email Assurance can re-run them on an ongoing basis BUT we do not want for you to send to them. If later determined to be valid addresses, they will get new Email Assurance Grades and will be appended to the updated segment within your MailChimpaccount.

To deploy a campaign to the 'Safe to Send' segment, go to the Campaigns tab on the left-hand side of your MailChimp Dashboard. Here you can create a new campaign, or replicate an old one, and send to an entire list or a segment.
to send only to the 'Safe to Send' list.

When lists are validated and uploaded directly to MailChimp, they contain all emails from your Free Email Assurance Report (with grades of A+, A, B, and D). Emails given a grade of F are undeliverable, and therefore invalid, so they are unsubscribed from your MailChimp list.Our recommendation is that you log in to MailChimpaccount and create segments for 'Safe to Send' emails, 'Accepts-All' emails, and 'Indeterminate' emails.

We do not recommendsending to the 'Accepts-All' segmentright away - but you can attempt a re-engagement campaign to emails with an Email Assurance Grade of B, and if any addresses in your 'Accepts-All' category are determined to be valid, you can then trickle them back into your 'Safe to Send' list very slowly!

We do not recommendsending to the 'Indeterminate' segmentever. You should create a segment for all emails with an Email Assurance Grade of D - but youshould not deploy to them. The reasoning is, we do not want to unsubscribe these from your list so that Email Assurance can re-run them on an ongoing basis BUT we do not want for you to send to them. If later determined to be valid addresses, they will get new Email Assurance Grades and will be appended to the updated segment within your MailChimp account.

Create a segment for 'Safe to Send' emails

This list is always safe to send to! You can start deploying email right away with the 'Safe to Send' list. When Email Assurance runs, we will consistently update this segment for you.

>

Set segment conditions and save

Setconditions for this list to be:

1. grade is A+ and...

2. grade is A

>

You can see how many people within your list fit into this category. Save your segment as something you will remember for later!

>

Create a segment for 'Accepts - All' emails (Grade = B)

This list is not safe to send to!Create a segment for the emails within your list that have an Email Assurance Grade of B - Deploy a re-engagement campaign to these emails ONLY and if they are determined to be valid and deliverable addresses, you can then trickle them into your listslowly.

>

Create a segment for 'Indeterminate' emails (Grade = D)

This list isneversafe to send to! Create a segment for for emails within your list that have an Email Assurance grade of D - Do not deploy email to this segment! We will auto-update this segment as Email Assurance runs, and any addresses determined to be valid will be moved to the updated segment.

>

Start sending mail! Deploy a campaign for 'Safe to Send' emails only

Send a test email to this segment ONLY to test the deliverability of maybe emails.

>How can I save and use segments in my list?

Login to

When you link a MailChimp account, all of the lists in your account will be imported for analysis. With a linked account, you can always take advantage of Free Email Assurance and monitor your lists on a daily basis.

If you purchase a One-Time Tune Up for a list, results will be automatically synced back to the ESP and you can continuously monitor your list's status. If you purchase Email Assurance for a list, list maintenance is on auto-pilot and your list will be analyzed and updated daily.

After making a purchase,results will be automatically synced back to your MailChimp account.

What's updated in your MailChimp account:

When lists are synced backall of your original information will be re-imported in your MailChimp account.Allemail addresses within your list will be updated and indexed with Email Assurance Grades from yourReport Card.

If you choose to unsubscribe all F grades we'll do that for you, but addresses will not be deleted from your MailChimp account. Invalid emails are given an Email Assurance Grade of F.

Creating Segments:

We recommend creating segments within your MailChimp account as soon as you purchase the first list. Create segments for 'Safe to Send', 'Accepts All', and Indeterminate' emails. (If you choose to keep addresses with F grades, create a 'Do Not Send' segment)

>How do I segment a list in MailChimp?

Login to

After purchasing a list, your data will automatically begin to sync back to your MailChimp account.

To see if your accounthas been updated, login to your MailChimp account and access the dashboard. View all of your email lists by clicking on the Lists tab on the left-side of the dashboard. Here you can view each list within your account.

Click onone of the list cleaned by DataValidation to seean Email Assurance Grade and the date Last Changed.

Create a Tag:

To add Tags to a group of people (rather than individual contacts) you must be create them by searching all Contacts, filtering, and applying the Tag to your filtered results. Make sure you are under the Contacts tab on the left hand side of your Constant Contact dashboard and access the Advanced section on Search Contacts.

>

The following tags will need to be created:

Safe to Send: A+ and A grades

Accepts All: B grades

Indeterminate: D grades

Advanced Searches will use the format custom_field_1 1 [is] +dv_grade_A+. To create a Safe to Send' group, Advance Search your Contacts for all A+ and A results, and add the Safe to Send' Tag to all Contacts who meet this criteria.

Once your Constant Contact account has been linked and your lists have completed the First Validation, your purchased lists will begin to sync back to your Constant Contact account.

Check the Status of a List:

Access the Contacts tab on the top right of your dashboard, and then click on the Activity tab. Here is where you can see recent imports, exports, and other transactions (such as those from DataValidation). When a list is synced back to your account, it will be listed as Activity Type: Import from external application.

>

Once your list has been synced back, you'll need to create Tags for Contacts. These Tags will be used to manage the contacts within your Email Lists. You must create Tags for all Safe to Send', Accepts All', and Indeterminate' Contacts. Those given a grade of F can still be found by clicking View All Contacts, but will no longer be listed in the original Email List.

DataValidation applies Email Assurance Grades (A+, A, B, F) to your Contacts by using Custom Fields. By default, DataValidation populates Custom Field 1 for grades (unless this field has already been used for additional information on your Contacts - In this case, access settings to determine which Custom Field was available).

Create a Tag:

To add Tags to a group of people (rather than individual contacts) you must be create them by searching all Contacts, filtering, and applying the Tag to your filtered results. Make sure you are under the Contacts tab on the left hand side of your Constant Contact dashboard and access the Advanced section on Search Contacts.

>

The following tags will need to be created:

Safe to Send: A+ and A grades

Accepts All: B grades

Indeterminate: D grades

Advanced Searches will use the format custom_field_1 1 [is] +dv_grade_A+. To create a Safe to Send' group, Advance Search your Contacts for all A+ and A results, and add the Safe to Send' Tag to all Contacts who meet this criteria.

>

Once your search is complete, click the top left box to select all Contacts that meet the criteria and access the Manage Tags tab. Apply the Tag to this group of people. Your Safe to Send' group is now set up and ready to receive mail.

You'll need to do the exact same thing to create Accepts All' and Indeterminate' Tags, and apply them to all Contacts that meet the criteria.

Send to the Safe to Send' Contacts Only:

To send to the Safe to Send' Contacts only, you'll need to narrow down lists when deploying a campaign. Under the Email tab on the top left of your dashboard, you'll be to create a new campaign, or access one already created. Once you're ready to send, select one (or multiple) lists to deploy your campaign to.

*This is very important: You must select all Email Lists you wish to send to before narrowing them down. If not, your tag will only apply to the lists selected before the Tag was applied.

After your Email list(s) have been selected, apply the Tag Safe to Send' to your list. Your campaign will be deployed to only the Safe to Send' Contacts within your list.

Custom fields in your Constant Contact account are how DataValidation stores Email Assurance Grades for your contacts. Custom fields can be edited when a list (or contact) is first upload to your Constant Contact account, within an individual contact's information, or through 'My Settings' on your dashboard.

**You can see which custom field is being used by DataValidation by looking at an individual contact's information. The Email Assurance Grade will be listed as a custom field in the following format:

>

Toview or edit custom fields for existing contacts, you'll want to do this through 'My Settings'. Once you access settings, click on 'Manage my custom settings', under 'Contact Settings.'

If you have a Constant Contact account that is linked to DataValidation, you have the option of having Email Assurance. Email Assurance is the ultimate list maintenance subscription, allowing you to monitor and remediate any Contacts automatically.

With Constant Contact, any additional data or information for Contacts (besides name, address, ect) must be stored a custom field. The only way to deploy campaigns to groups of Contacts, based on this custom data, is to create Tags.

Email Assurance runs once every day, pulling in any new Contact data you have manually added to your lists,and has been added due signup forms. Existing data within your account is also re-ran on a weekly basis. What this means is that if you've created Tags for 'Safe to Send', 'Accepts All', and 'Indeterminate' Contacts, you'll need to make sure these are refreshed each time you deploy a campaign!

>How do I create custom Tags in Constant Contact?

How to update Tags before sending a campaign:

To update Tags before sending, you'll follow almost the same procedure as creatingthem. First, you'll need to do an 'Advanced Search' for 'Safe to Send' Contacts only. These are the only contacts we recommend sending mail to.

>

'Safe to Send' Contacts are all those with A+ and A grades. Remember tosearch all Contacts (and not just those within a specific list). Also, all Email Assurance Grades are listed in the format: +dv_grade_A+

>

Once you hit 'Search' you'll be taken back to the main Contacts screen. Here, click the the top left check-box to select all Contacts listed as having Email Assurance Grades of A+ and A. Click on the 'Manage Tags' button that appears when you select all, and ensure that 'Safe to Send' has a check mark by it!

DataValidation has just released the new Email Assurance app in beta! If you're one of our beta testers, this article is for you. Here's everything you need to get started in the new app:

Link an ESP account

Email Assurance allows you to link a MailChimp or Constant Contact account right off the bat! Do this when signing up, or add it later. You can add multiple accounts, and even upload .csv files if you'd like.

Linked and Unlinked Lists

Once you've linked all of your ESP accounts (and uploaded all of your .csv files) you can view all lists in the Linked Lists and Unlinked Lists tabs. Linked Lists include all email lists from any linked MailChimp or Constant Contact account.

Unlinked Lists include any lists from a previously linked ESP account, and all .csv files you have manually uploaded. (ie. If you unlink an ESP account, you can still find your lists in this section)

>

Report Cards

Each list is given an Overall List Grade. This percentage is an average for a particular list.The front of each card will also tell you:

  • Date the list was imported to Email Assurance
  • Number of subscribers in the list
  • ESP Account
  • ESP Account login
  • Whether a list has been purchase
  • How many days remaining in your 30-day free trial
  • Whether a list is Assured/Not Assured

By flipping a card over you can view the list's Report Card. A list's Report Card will tell you:

  • The percentage of emails that have each Email Assurance grade
  • A description of each Email Assurance Grade
  • Date of the list's latest validation
  • Number of subscribers when the list was linked

Progress Reports

In a list's Report Card, you can click on Progress Report to see the list's progress over time. The Progress Report also tells you the Overall List Grade, number of subscribers in the list, date the list was imported to Email Assurance, and details on the linked ESP account.

583419>

By clicking on the first data point you can see what your list looked like at the time of import. The Progress Report also shows the percentage of emails that have each Email Assurance grade. Easily compare Weekly Checks and Daily Checks.

Email Assurance runs once daily to check for newly added data and re-analyzes existing data weekly. It's free to monitor your lists for as long as you like.

Purchase Email Assurance or Email Assurance to sync results back to your ESP account and get an address-by-address analysis for your lists.

Sync back to an ESP

If you have a linked MailChimp or Constant Contact account, you can purchase Email Assurance or Email Assurance and have your results automatically synced back to your ESP account. If you have the Email Assurance subscription, your lists will be analyzed and synced back to your account daily.

MailChimp users,

>create segments and deploy only to your Safe to Send subscribers.

Constant Contact users,

>create tags and deploy only to your Safe to Send contacts.

Once you've purchased, you'll also have the option of downloading an address-by-address analysis in addition to your ESP sync. If you uploaded a .csv file, you will be able to download the address-by-address analysisas well.

Address-by-Address Analysis

Thisis a downloadable .csv file that contains an address-by-address analysis for each email within a list. This analysis containsdeliverability data that makes up the Email Assurance grade given to a particular address.

This downloadable report has Email Assurance Grades, Historical Engagement (Clicks, Opens), Historical Bounces, Historical Complaints, Historical Opt-Outs, History of Deceased, and History of Spam Traps.

Look here for more information on the

>Add to Cart or Download

In the list view of the Email Assurance app, you have the ability to add multiple lists to a cart and download multiple items at a time.

580366>

Dashboard

Your Dashboard is where you can view the overall status and progress of all of the lists in your DataValidation account. Whether you have 1 linked account or 3, the Dashboard will show you Status Over Time, Assurance Coverage, New Emails Added, and Emails Unsubscribed for the current aggregate of all lists in the system.

>

Aggregate Score of All Lists: This score can be found in the top left corner of your DataValidation Dashboard. The score takes into account every Overall List Grade.

Status Over Time: This percentage represents the changes (trending up or down) to the aggregate score of all lists.

Assurance Coverage: This is a percentage of all lists covered by the Email Assurance subscription. The only lists within your account that are available for the subscription are those that have been linked by MailChimp or Constant Contact.

New Emails Added: This number is the total number of emails added to your lists at this particular moment. This includes manual uploads, new signups to your list ornew addressesthat have been recently pulled in by Email Assurance from your ESP account.

Emails Unsubscribed: This represents the total number of emails unsubscribed across lists. This takes into account the number of emails unsubscribed by DataValidation (due to an F grade) and the number of emails you have manually unsubscribed or that have unsubscribed themselves from your mailings.

Linked Accounts, Profile Settings, and Billing

In the Linked Accounts tab you can view every ESP account you have linked to DataValidation. Here, you can unlink an account and refresh accounts. If you unlink an account, Email Assurance WILL NOT be able to run.Refreshing an account pulls in any new/existing data from your ESP account (this can only be done once a day).

In the Profile Settings tab you can verify and change your primary mailing address, update personal information and change your password.

In the Billing Information tab you cansave a credit card for purchases, change billing information and view any purchases you have made. You can even view your receipt for every purchase you have made!

Notifications & Cart

Whenever you sync an ESP account, or upload a new list, you'll get notifications letting you know that your list has been analyzed.

You can now add lists to your cart and continue viewing reports within your Dashboard, Linked Lists, and Unlinked Lists. By clicking on the Cart notifications you can see what your total for the day is, as well as what an Email Assurance subscription would look like for the lists you are purchasing.

When you link a Constant Contactaccount, all of the lists within the account will be imported to DataValidation. Lists will automatically start to process. Once lists have completed, view your Always Free Email Assurance Report for each list imported and analyzed.

After purchasing a list, the data will automatically sync back to your Constant Contact account.

What's updated in your Constant Contactaccount:

When list results are updated, all of your original information will be re-imported into Constant Contact. All contacts will be updated will an Email Assurance Grade. This grade can be found by viewingan individual contact.

DataValidation uses custom fields to store the Email Assurance Grade. To find out which custom field has been used, access an individual contact. All grades will be listed in the following format:

>How do I manage custom fields?

All undeliverable contacts (those with a grade of F) will be unsubscribed across lists within your Constant Contact account. These undeliverable contacts can still be found under the 'View All Contacts' tab within your account, but will not be included in your 'Active Contacts' or in your 'Email Lists'.

After the data has been synced back to your Constant Contact account, you'll need to create custom Tags to group contacts into 'Safe to Send, 'Accepts All', and 'Indeterminate' contacts. Tags will be used to narrow down an Email List when sending a campaign. Only deploy email to the 'Safe to Send' contacts.

Once you've uploaded results, you'll want to segment your list! Create segments for emails in the Safe to Send, Accepts-All, and Indeterminate categories.

If you've received a warning message from MailChimp, there's something wrong or suspicious about one of your campaigns or lists. If you receive warnings repeatedly on your account, it will be suspended. That's where we come in.

If you've only gotten one or two warnings, find out How to Stay in Compliance with MailChimp to make sure this doesn't keep happening.

Bounce Warnings:

If you're receiving a Bounce Warning, it's because your bounce rate is higher than industry thresholds, or higher than normal, on a particular send. MailChimp aims to warn you of this behavior before suspending your account.Consistently exceeding the bounce threshold is concerning, and means that you are not reaching your audience due to invalid email addresses.

Unsubscribe Warnings:

If you're receiving an Unsubscribe Warning, it's because some of your subscribers no longer want to receive your campaigns. Warnings mean that you have a high unsubscribe rate, which are dangerous to your email reputation and deliverability.A rising unsubscribe rate will lead to account suspension.

If you're getting warnings from MailChimp, it's a sign that you need to have your list cleaned. Get rid of unwanted emails that are undeliverable and have a history of bouncing, complaining, and opting-out of emails lists.

Login to
If you linked an account or uploaded a list and got a message saying,

this means that your list has been flagged by our automated abuse detection program. This software scans our database to detect lists that arepotentiallyharmful and pause their validation process until the list can be reviewed.

We do this to protect our system against a DHA, or Directory Harvest Attack, and keep the data of all customers safe. If a list has many addresses that are similar (ie. role addresses) such as sales@apple.com or support@apple.com, then it will be flagged for review.

If you've noticed that your list has been flagged, you will ned to contact our support team at

>support@datavalidation.comwith this issue. Your email list will be forwarded to an engineer for further review and we'll contact you with the updated status of your list!

Login to

1. Make sure you have purchased your list from DataValidation

After having a list analyzed you'll be able to purchase Email Assurance or Email Validation. Email Assurance is an ongoing subscription offered to customers with linked MailChimp accounts.

>

2. Make sure you have Uploaded Results to MailChimp

Once your list has processed, the Purchase Email validation button will change to a button that says
. From here you'll be able to
if you have a linked MailChimp account. You must push Upload Results for your MailChimp account to be updated.

>

3. Make sure you do NOT have more than 30 merge fields set in MailChimp.

MailChimp's merge fields are where all subscriber information is stored, such as email address, phone number, ect. When uploading your information back to MailChimp, we attempt to create custom merge fields for the information found in your Email Assurance Report. MailChimp limits you to 30 merge fields, so you'll want to make sure that you have room for DataValidation's information.

Edit your merge fields by accessing your list in your MailChimp Dashboard. Under the the
tab, click on List Fields and *|MERGE|* tags. Make sure you have less than 30 fields so that DataValidation can properly upload your information.

>

4. Make sure none of your merge fields are set to

If any of your merge fields are set to be required, your MailChimp upload may not load correctly. If a field is set to be required, it means that every subscriber entering information must include this data - even DataValidation.

If you're a MailChimp customer, you can easily download a Bounce Report from your MailChimp Dashboard. In the case that something goes wrong with your cleaned list, a bounce report is one of the easiest ways for us to find out what's going on with your list!

To download your Bounce Report, login to your MailChimp account and access the Campaigns tab on the left-hand side of your screen. Here, you can view allrecent campaignsand click

next to the campaign in question.

Click on
tab and here you'll be able to view which emails bounced back after sending the campaign. Simply download the report and we'll happy to take a look at it for you!

Progress Reports

For each list in your Email Assurance account you will have a Report Card and a Progress Report.

In a list's Report Card, you can click on Progress Report to see the list's progress overtime. The Progress Report also tells you the Overall List Grade, number of subscribers in the list, date the list was imported to Email Assurance, and details on the linked ESP account.

When you sign up for an account at MailChimp, you're constantly monitored for any signs of abuse. When MailChimp sees things that need explaining on your end, or investigating on their end, your account may be flagged and the review team might take some time to check things out. For a list of Red Flags view this MailChimp article:http://kb.mailchimp.com/article/why-was-my-account-suspended/

Here are the things you can do to speed up the review process by MailChimp:

<
  1. Make sure your account is compliant with MailChimp's

>Terms of Use.
  • Set up a list and a campaign that includes real content that you actually plan on sending to your list.MailChimpcan't begin the review process until a campaign and list are in place.
  • Check to see that you have a good Permission Reminder in place for all lists in your account. You'll find the Permission Reminder underLists > settings > required email footer content. Need some help? Here are some pointers on<

>What Makes a Good Permission Reminder.
  • Include a valid postal address in any campaigns you plan on sending through us. A postal address is
>required by the Federal Can-Spam Act, so MailChimp has to make sure you include it.

>Why is my MailChimp account suspended?

Login to

If your account with an email service providerhas been suspended, then may have received warnings andand know that you can no longer send email. When your account is suspended, your ESPis attempting to protect their own sender reputation by blocking you.

There are several reasons why your ESPmay have suspended your account: u2028u2028

  • Terms of Use Were Violated
  • High Abuse Complaints
  • High Bounce Rates
  • High Unsubscribe Rates
  • Direct Complaints
  • Email lists fall out of compliance

Email Assurance Grades:

This analysis contains Deliverability Codes which determine an email's Email Assurance Grade.Your Address-by-Address Analysiswill provide you with the following:

Address-by-Address Analysis

Your Always Free Email Assurance Report has already provided you with the number of emails that have each Email Assurance Grade. Now, with your Address-by-Address Analysis, you can dive deep into your email list to see exactly which emails have which grade, and why they were given that grade. Each address is also provided with Deliverability Codes that determine which grade they are given.

Deliverability Codes:

Deliverability Codes are what make up an Email Assurance Grade, telling you which emails on your list are deliverable or not. These codes will provide information for each email based on their deliverability and email engagement status.DeliverabilityCodesare provided on a scale of 1-4, with 1 being least deliverable and 4 being most deliverable.

Hard Bounces (H)

Historical Hard Bounce information will be provided for each email address within your list. This information provides you insight by showing you which emails have a hard bounce historyand how many sources we've received this information from.

A code of H1-H4 specifies an emails' historical hard bounce information:

  • H4:No Historical Hard BounceInfo: This email has neverhard bounced
  • H3: Single-sourced historical bounce: This address has bounced once; info provided from at least 1 source
  • H2: Double-sourced historical bounce: This address has bounced multiple times; info provided from at least 2 sources
  • H1:Multi-sourced historical bounce: This email has bounced multiple times; info provided from multiple sources

Opt-Outs (O)

Historical Opt-Outs determine the number of people on your email list that have a history of opting-out, or unsubscribing, from email lists. A subscribers opt-outhistory is based on their overall email history.

A code of O1-O4 specifies an emails' historical opt-out information:

  • O4: No Historical OptOut Info: This email has never unsubscribed
  • O3: Single Sourced Historical OptOut: This email has unsubscribed in the past; info from at least 1 source
  • O2: DoubleSourced Historical OptOut: This email has unsubscribed more than once in the past; from at least 2 sources
  • O1:Multi-Sourced Historical OptOut: This email frequently unsubscribes; info from multiple sources

Complainers (W)

Complainers are people who have a history of reporting email as spam. A historical complainer code will indicate whether a given email address on your list has a history of complaining about email or not.

A code of W1-W4 specifies an emails' historical complaint information:

  • W4: No Historical Complainer Info: has never marked email as SPAM
  • W3: Single Sourced Historical Complainer: This address has marked email as SPAM; info from at least 1 source
  • W2: DoubleSourced Historical Complainer: This address has marked email as SPAM more than once, info from at least 2 sources
  • W1:Multi-Sourced Historical Complainer: This email frequently marks other email as spam, info from multiple sources

Spam-Traps (T)

Emails on your list that were once deliverable and safe to send to also have the potential of turning into a spam trap if left inactive for long periods of time. When an email address is set up for the sole purpose of detecting and catching spammers, it's usually not connected to a

inbox and is considered a spam trap.

A code of T1 or T4 specifies an emails' spam-trap information:

  • T4: We HaveNoHistorical Trap Info - This email address has no history as being a spam trap. This is not a guarantee that an email isn't a spam trap, only a historical data point.
  • T1:Historical Spam Trap Info - This email address has been listed as a spam trap. It is possible that it may no longer be a spam trap.

**Please Note:We no longer include spam trap data in determining our Email Assurance Grades (A+, A, B, D, F) - this information changes frequently and we cannot guarantee every instance to be accurate.This information will still be provided for each email in your Address-by-Address Analysis and can used for segmenting your list.

Deceased Individuals (D)

Sometimes old email lists contain addresses belonging to people who have passed away. This email address may still be listed as active or could turn into a spam trap sometime in the future. This code indicates whether an email address belongs to a person who is deceased or not.

A code of D4 or D1 specifies if a person with this email has Historical Deceased Information:

  • D4:Nohistorical deceased information (the user is living)
  • D1:Historical deceased information (the user is deceased)

**Please Note:We no longer include deceased individuals' data in determining our Email Assurance Grades (A+, A, B, D, F) - this information changes frequently and we cannot guarantee every instance to be accurate.This information will still be provided for each email in your Address-by-Address Analysis and can used for segmenting your list.

HistoricalOpens (R)

This is a measure of the historical level of engagement based on the amount of deliverable mail sent to an address. This is a historical reference, anddoes not determinehow likely one is to open your email.

Acode of R4 or R1 specifies an address's history of email opens:

  • R4: Amajorityof emails delivered to the address historically resulted in an open
  • R3:Mostof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in an open
  • R2:Someof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in an open
  • R1: Veryfewof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in an open
  • R0:We have no historical data around email opens for this address

Historical Clicks (K)

This is a measure of the historical level of engagement based on the amount of deliverable mail sent to an address. This is a historical reference, anddoes not determinehow likely one is to click your email.

A code of K4 or K1 specifies an address's history of email clicks:

  • K4: Amajorityof emails delivered to the address historically resulted in a click
  • K3:Mostof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in a click
  • K2:Someof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in a click
  • K1: Veryfewof the emails delivered to the address historically resulted in a click
  • K0: We have no historical data around email clicks for this address

FAQson DataValidation Pricing, Email Validation, Email Assurance, and the Always Free Email Assurance Report.

Do I have to sign up with a credit card?

No, you do not need to use a credit card when signing up for DataValidation. Signup, load a list or link your MailChimp account, and receive an Always Free Email Assurance Report -no credit card required.

Do I need to pay before validating my data?

No, you do not need to pay before having an email list validated. Upload a list or link an ESP, have your list validated, and view your Always Free Email Assurance Reportbefore you buy!

How do I know how much my list will cost?

Email lists are priced on a per email basis. You can easily calculate the cost of your list using our pricing page before you purchase.

Is there a minimum price I have to spend?

No, there is no minimum price you must spend (or number of emails you must have) to validate with DataValidation. Although, some credit card companies do require a minimum of $0.50 to purchase.

Are there requirements my list must have?

There are no requirements on the size of your list. Upload a list of any size, from anywhere, at anytime! We do require that uploaded files be in a .csv or .xls file, and that all emails be in the first column with no additional data in this column.

How long does it take to validate my email list?

The time it takes to validate your list is based on the number of emails you have in this list. Generally, it takes only a couple of hours to validate!

How do I use your service?

By creating an account, you can simply upload a list to be validated or link your MailChimp account and have your list(s) imported. After validation, view your Always Free Email Assurance Report to make an informed purchase decision. You'll have the option of purchasing Email Validation for your email list or Email Assurance for a linked account.

How is my Email Assurance Report

?

With DataValidation, you can upload a list at any time and get an Always Free Email Assurance Report. This report is always available for your viewing -no purchase necessary! Upload as many lists as you need to check the deliverability status by using your Always Free Email Assurance Report. It's always free to know.

What kind of information does the Email Assurance Report tell me?

Your Always Free Email Assurance Report tells you if emails on your list are deliverable or undeliverable by providing you with Email Assurance Grades for the emails on your list. Purchase your list to get an Address-by-Address Analysis containing Deliverability Codes for each email. Codes are provided for historical bounces, historical complaints, historical opt-outs, spam traps, deceased individuals, historical opens and click data.

Do you offer a subscription service?

Yes! By linking yourMailChimp account, have all of the lists in this account validated and they'll be eligible for the Email Assurance subscription. This subscription monitors every list in your linked account to ensure compliance and deliverability. More on Email Assurance

>here!

What is the difference in one-time Email Validation and the Email Assurance subscription?

By uploading an email list or linking an account, you can have any list cleaned as a one-time service. If you've linked an account, you can also have a list cleaned one time, but you also have the option of signing up for the ongoing, monitoring subscription. With this subscription, all lists are validated and are updated daily.

Why should I validate with DataValidation?

With our self-service platform, you can easily upload lists of any size and link an ESP account with ease. The validation process is fast, comprehensive, and provides you with an Always Free Email Assurance Report to help you make an informed purchase decision. First thing's first. As a MailChimp user and DataValidation customer we want you to be as educated as possible when it comes to the deliverability of your email lists. Glance at these best practices and compliance tips to get familiar with MailChimp's standards before getting started.

>General Compliance Tips

Start out by making sure your list is okay to use in MailChimp. You can view some common scenarios of list building to double check if your list is okay. The rule of thumb is to make sure youalwayshave permission to email the subscribers on your list. Use a double opt-in to ensure your subscribers want to receive your mail!
>Is my list okay to use in MailChimp?

>The importance of permission

If you want to be proactive, or you think you may risk getting flagged or suspended by MailChimp, you'll want to have your list cleaned of undeliverable emails. MailChimp doesn't do this for you, but luckily we've got you covered. We partner with MailChimp and hope to provide you with the most information possible about this process.

>Why can't I use MailChimp to clean my list?

Once you've had a list cleaned, we will update your MailChimp account and append all delivery data, including Email Assurance Grades and Deliverability Codes, to your lists. We'll identify which emails are 'Safe to Send', 'Accepts-All', and 'Indeterminate'.

We recommend segmenting and deploying to the 'Safe to Send' emails only (with grades of A+ and A)to get the most out of your list. By having a list cleaned with DataValidation, you'resending to emails that have been verified as deliverable and do not have a history of bouncing, complaining, or being a spam-trap.

>How can I save and use segments in my list?

Overtime your email list(s) have the potential of going stale. People change emails or start using new ones, pass away, and leave inboxes unattended to. The permission you asked for previously from all of your subscribers (through opt-in or double opt-in) goes stale, and this usually happens in only 3-6 months, causingyour list to be stale. This can happen even after having a list cleaned multiple times. This is why we offer theEmail Assurancesubscription specifically for MailChimp customers!

>About List Suspension

Keep your MailChimp list(s) clean with ongoing list maintenance! With the Email Assurance subscription, we'll monitor your lists on an ongoing basis and update them regularly so that you're always Safe to Send!

We perform several checks and verifications to determine whether an email address is valid or invalid.

To find out if an email is valid, we do aDNS verification and MX lookup, conduct anSMTP check, access our internal databases, and use proprietary algorithms.

>

In validation we ask certain questions like the ones below:

Does the email address...

  • contain the necessary elements to be an email address, like an @ and correct punctuation for hostname?have a valid hostname (johndoe@hostname.com)?
  • have a verifiable DNS and valid email server?
  • contain a valid local part (ie. localpart@hostname.com)?
  • contain less than 254 characters?
  • have a mailbox that can be reached?
  • belong to a server that accepts all email?

We then perform additional deliverability and compliance checks to find:
